title: U.S. per capita consumption of fresh fruit by fruit type 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds and Cherries has the lowest Per capita consumption in pounds.
The difference of Per capita consumption in pounds between the highest and lowest Fruits is 26.9.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 28.2 is found at Fruits Bananas and the minimum is found at Cherries where Fruits is 1.3.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds and Cherries has the lowest Per capita consumption in pounds.
The difference of Per capita consumption in pounds between the highest and lowest Fruits is 26.9.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
The maximum Per capita consumption in pounds 28.2 is found at Fruits Bananas and the minimum is found at Cherries where Fruits is 1.3.
Second maximum Per capita consumption in pounds is found at Fruits Apples.
There is a difference of 26.9 between the maximum Fruits Bananas and minimum Fruits Cherries.
Fruits Bananas is higher than any other Fruitss with value 28.2, followed by Apples, and Oranges. Down to Fruits Cherries with the lowest value 1.3.
The Fruits Cherries tends to be 3.27 percent lower than average.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is 94.9 if we add up values of all Fruitss.
